obfuscation: Instead of doin ' your rightful work ye 've been below here gossipin ' erstwhile women 's talk with that boy .
original:
Instead of doin' your rightful work ye've been below here
gossipin' old women's talk with that boy.

obfuscation: Get away o ' this you !
original:
Get out
o' this you!

obfuscation: Clean up the chart room .
original: Clean up the chart room.

obfuscation: Pick up that dish , Mr .
original: Pick up that dish, Mr.

obfuscation: Steward !
original: Steward!

obfuscation: Yes , sir .
original: Yes, sir.

obfuscation: The next dish you break , Mr .
original: The next dish you break, Mr.

obfuscation: Steward , you take a bath in the Behring Sea at the end of a rope .
original:
Steward, you take a bath in the
Behring Sea at the end of a rope.

obfuscation: Yes , sir .
original: Yes, sir.

obfuscation: I war n't 'specially anxious the man at the wheel should catch what I wanted to say to you , sir .
original:
I warn't 'specially anxious the man at the wheel should catch what
I wanted to say to you, sir.

obfuscation: That 's why I asked you to come below .
original: That's why I asked you to come below.

obfuscation: Speak your say , Mr. Slocum .
original: Speak your say, Mr. Slocum.

obfuscation: I 'm afeared there 'll be trouble with the hands by the look o ' things .
original:
I'm afeared there'll be
trouble with the hands by the look o' things.

obfuscation: They 'll likely turn ugly , every blessed one o ' them , if you do n't put back .
original:
They'll likely turn ugly,
every blessed one o' them, if you don't put back.

obfuscation: The two years they signed up for is up to-day .
original:
The two years they
signed up for is up to-day.

obfuscation: And d'you think you 're tellin ' me something new , Mr. Slocum ?
original: And d'you think you're tellin' me something new, Mr. Slocum?

obfuscation: I 've felt it in the air this retentive time past .
original: I've felt it in the air this long time past.

obfuscation: D'you think I 've not seen their ugly looks and the grudgin ' way they worked ?
original:
D'you think I've not seen
their ugly looks and the grudgin' way they worked?

obfuscation: Well , Annie ?
original: Well, Annie?

obfuscation: David , I -- Wait !
original:
David, I--

Wait!

obfuscation: Yes , sir .
original: Yes, sir.

obfuscation: D'you want anything , Annie ?
original: D'you want anything, Annie?

obfuscation: I thought maybe -- I 'd go up on deck , David , to get a breath of fresh air .
original:
I thought maybe--I'd go up on deck, David, to
get a breath of fresh air.

obfuscation: It 's besides cold , Annie .
original: It's too cold, Annie.

obfuscation: You 'd best stay below .
original: You'd best stay below.

obfuscation: There 's nothing to look at on deck -- but ice .
original:
There's nothing to
look at on deck--but ice.

obfuscation: I know -- ice , ice , ice !
original: I know--ice, ice, ice!

obfuscation: But there 's nothing to see down here but these walls .
original:
But there's nothing
to see down here but these walls.

obfuscation: You can play the organ , Annie .
original: You can play the organ, Annie.

obfuscation: I hate the organ .
original: I hate the organ.

obfuscation: It puts me in mind of home .
original: It puts me in mind of home.

obfuscation: I got it jest for you !
original: I got it jest for you!

obfuscation: I know .
original: I know.

obfuscation: Ah , water !
original: Ah, water!

obfuscation: Clear water !
original: Clear water!

obfuscation: As far as I can see !
original: As far as I can see!

obfuscation: How good it looks after all these months of ice !
original:
How good it looks after all these
months of ice!

obfuscation: Ah , nowadays I must go up on deck and look at it , David !
original: Ah, now I must go up on deck and look at it, David!

obfuscation: Best not to-day , Annie .
original: Best not to-day, Annie.

obfuscation: Best wait for a day when the sun shines .
original:
Best wait for a day when
the sun shines.

obfuscation: But the sun never shines in this terrible place .
original:
But the sun never shines in this terrible
place.

obfuscation: Best not to-day , Annie .
original: Best not to-day, Annie.

obfuscation: Very well , David .
original: Very well, David.

obfuscation: Annie !
original: Annie!

obfuscation: Yes , David .
original: Yes, David.

obfuscation: Me and Mr. Slocum has business to talk about -- ship 's business .
original: Me and Mr. Slocum has business to talk about--ship's business.

obfuscation: Very well , David .
original: Very well, David.

obfuscation: Best not have her on deck if they 's goin ' to be any trouble .
original: Best not have her on deck if they's goin' to be any trouble.

obfuscation: Yes , sir .
original: Yes, sir.

obfuscation: And trouble they 's going to be .
original: And trouble they's going to be.

obfuscation: I feel it in my bones .
original: I feel it in my bones.

obfuscation: Got your'n ?
original: Got your'n?

obfuscation: Yes , sir .
original: Yes, sir.

obfuscation: Not that we 'll have to use 'em -- not if I know their breed of dog -- jest to frighten 'em up a bit .
original:
Not that we'll have to use 'em--not if I know their breed of
dog--jest to frighten 'em up a bit.

obfuscation: I ai n't never been forced to use one yit ; and trouble I 've had by land and by ocean s'long as I kin remember , and will have till my dyin ' day , I reckon .
original:
I ain't never been
forced to use one yit; and trouble I've had by land and by sea s'long as
I kin remember, and will have till my dyin' day, I reckon.

obfuscation: Then you ai n't goin ' -- to turn back ?
original: Then you ain't goin'--to turn back?

obfuscation: Turn back !
original: Turn back!

obfuscation: Mr. Slocum , did you ever hear o ' me pointin ' s'uth for home with only a measly four hundred barrel of ile in the hold ?
original:
Mr. Slocum, did you ever hear o' me pointin' s'uth
for home with only a measly four hundred barrel of ile in the hold?
